snippet: The inquiries are reminiscent of an investigation started in 2002, when the district attorney conducted a large-scale review of potential fraud in sales tax payments on art purchases.
abstract: Art galleries and dealers across New York City receive subpoenas for sales and shipping records; action suggests that investigators may again be pressing issue of tax evasion in the art world.

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and ROBIN POGREBIN

lead_paragraph: The inquiries are reminiscent of an investigation started in 2002, when the district attorney conducted a large-scale review of potential fraud in sales tax payments on art purchases.
